commands.help:
[1mUsage:[22m heroku console [34m[flags][39m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP        [2mapp to run command against[22m
 -e, --env ENV        [2menvironment variables to set (use ';' to split multiple vars)[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE  [2mgit remote of app to use[22m
 -s, --size SIZE      [2mdyno size[22m

commands.description: run a detached dyno, where output is sent to your logs
commands.help:
[1mUsage:[22m heroku run:detached [34m[flags][39m

[1mrun a detached dyno, where output is sent to your logs[22m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP        [2mapp to run command against[22m
 -e, --env ENV        [2menvironment variables to set (use ';' to split multiple vars)[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE  [2mgit remote of app to use[22m
 -s, --size SIZE      [2mdyno size[22m
 -t, --tail           [2mstream logs from the dyno[22m
 --type TYPE          [2mprocess type[22m

Example:

    $ heroku run:detached ls
    Running ls on app [detached]... up, run.1
    Run heroku logs -a app -p run.1 to view the output.
helpLine: [2mrun a detached dyno, where output is sent to your logs[22m

commands.description: run a one-off process inside an existing heroku dyno
commands.help:
[1mUsage:[22m heroku run:inside [34m[flags][39m

[1mrun a one-off process inside an existing heroku dyno[22m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP        [2mapp to run command against[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE  [2mgit remote of app to use[22m
 --env ENV            [2menvironment variables to set (use ';' to split multiple vars)[22m
 --exit-code          [2mpassthrough the exit code of the remote command[22m

Examples:

  $ heroku run:inside web.1 bash
  Running bash on web.1.... up
  ~ $
helpLine: [2mrun a one-off process inside an existing heroku dyno[22m

commands.help:
[1mUsage:[22m heroku logs [34m[flags][39m

[1mdisplay recent log output[22m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP        [2mapp to run command against[22m
 -d, --dyno DYNO      [2mdyno to limit filter by[22m
 -n, --num NUM        [2mnumber of lines to display[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE  [2mgit remote of app to use[22m
 -s, --source SOURCE  [2mlog source to limit filter by[22m
 -t, --tail           [2mcontinually stream logs[22m
 --force-colors       [2mforce use of colors (even on non-tty output)[22m

Example:

    $ heroku logs
    2012-01-01T12:00:00+00:00 heroku[api]: Config add EXAMPLE by email@example.com
    2012-01-01T12:00:01+00:00 heroku[api]: Release v1 created by email@example.com

[1mUsage:[22m heroku rake [34m[flags][39m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP        [2mapp to run command against[22m
 -e, --env ENV        [2menvironment variables to set (use ';' to split multiple vars)[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE  [2mgit remote of app to use[22m
 -s, --size SIZE      [2mdyno size[22m
 -x, --exit-code      [2mpassthrough the exit code of the remote command[22m
 --no-tty             [2mforce the command to not run in a tty[22m

commands.description: run a one-off process inside a heroku dyno
commands.help:
[1mUsage:[22m heroku run [34m[flags][39m

[1mrun a one-off process inside a heroku dyno[22m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP        [2mapp to run command against[22m
 -e, --env ENV        [2menvironment variables to set (use ';' to split multiple vars)[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE  [2mgit remote of app to use[22m
 -s, --size SIZE      [2mdyno size[22m
 -x, --exit-code      [2mpassthrough the exit code of the remote command[22m
 --no-notify          [2mdisables notification when dyno is up (alternatively use HEROKU_NOTIFICATIONS=0)[22m
 --no-tty             [2mforce the command to not run in a tty[22m
 --type TYPE          [2mprocess type[22m

Shows a notification if the dyno takes more than 20 seconds to start.

Examples:

    $ heroku run bash
    Running bash on app.... up, run.1
    ~ $

    $ heroku run -s hobby -- myscript.sh -a arg1 -s arg2
    Running myscript.sh -a arg1 -s arg2 on app.... up, run.1
helpLine: [2mrun a one-off process inside a heroku dyno[22m

topics.name: run
topics.description: run a one-off process inside a Heroku dyno
